it’s obviously undeniable to say that social media bring many benefits to us.with the social media,we can contact with each other easily.when we need to complete some group projects,it helps us improve the efficiency of communication and get the instant feedback.what’s more,when we have some questions and need to ask teachers,sending them a message or an email is convenient,which is useful to improve students’ study.besides,there are lots of video platforms rising in these years,such as bilibili,tiktok，the red book,which include a large number of popular science videos for public to study.at the same time,there are also abundant authoritative resources which are post by official accounts for academic study,greatly alleviated the difficulties in university students’ study.different people maybe have different methods to solve a same problem so that university students are able to make an ideological spark with others.social media is a helpful tool to narrow the urban-rural gap.it solves part of the teacher and educational resources shortage problems,which protect rural students’ right to acquire knowledge.the setting of course playback fosters students’ recognition of knowledge and helps us adapt and understand the courses easily.in the mental aspect,university students usually share their moment on wechat to express their different feelings.for example,when we finish a heavy project,we may choose to share their achievement or success with our friends and receive some blessing that help us have more energy to stick on studying.it produces a positive effect.

with the rapid advancement of technology,our society is undergoing profound changes in terms of education patterns.more and more university students start to use social media to study in the university.according to a china youth news survey in 2013 shows that 97.4% university students who was interviewed use social media to help them study in their daily lives,the proportion of using social media to study everyday reached 50.8%,the proportion of using it three or four times a week reached 28.6%.with the outbreak of covid-19 in 2020,students who couldn’t go back to school had online classes to ensure our normal study.however,going through the online classes,many students’ exam scores were sharply lower than before and we can’t focus on their works like before.so the debate whether social media is a helpful tool or a harmful distraction has intensified in recent years.

this essay has discussed how social media impact university students’ studies and lives.in conclusion,to a certain extent,social media both help and hurt our studies.not only does it help us connect with other easily,get more information,balance the resources between urban students and rural students and improve our mental health,but it also hurt our eyesight,fix our mind and shift our attention out of the studies.nevertheless,social media comes into our university life is the inevitable trend.what we need to do is to weigh the pros and cons,embrace it positively and make it add the bright colour and full energy in our university life.

although it seems that social media is a helpful tool,it is also seen as harmful distraction.first of all,it causes physical problems.a long time electronic products using is harm to students’ eyesight.it may also lead to other eye disease,such as dry eye syndrome,conjunctivitis.the proportion of myopia among student group is increasing.there is mountains of fake information on social media which mislead students on their study.in addition,when people use the social media,many of us feel that time flies and if we don’t pay attention to the time,it may waste their time.people’s studies or works will be delay.social media can make our brain produce dopamine,which constantly arouses our desires to watch it.but when we start to study,we will feel bored and lose patience just for a few minutes.then we couldn’t help watching our social media many times and hardly focusing on what we really need to do.it made us distracted.“when university students attend to interruptions from their vast array of media devices while studying, one ramification appears to be an increase in the amount of time it takes them to study compared to simply studying without interference.

it’s obviously undeniable to say that social media bring many benefits to us.with the social media,we can contact with each other easily.when we need to complete some group projects,it helps us improve the efficiency of communication and get the instant feedback.what’s more,when we have some questions and need to ask teachers,sending them a message or an email is convenient,which is useful to improve students’ study.besides,there are lots of video platforms rising in these years,such as bilibili,tiktok，the red book,which include a large number of popular science videos for public to study.at the same time,there are also abundant authoritative resources which are post by official accounts for academic study,greatly alleviated the difficulties in university students’ study.different people maybe have different methods to solve a same problem so that university students are able to make an ideological spark with others.social media is a helpful tool to narrow the urban-rural gap.it solves part of the teacher and educational resources shortage problems,which protect rural students’ right to acquire knowledge.the setting of course playback fosters students’ recognition of knowledge and helps us adapt and understand the courses easily.in the mental aspect,university students usually share their moment on wechat to express their different feelings.for example,when we finish a heavy project,we may choose to share their achievement or success with our friends and receive some blessing that help us have more energy to stick on studying.it produces a positive effect.

on the other hand,social media can be harmful as a sweet trap if you can not resist the algorithm which is be carefully designed to attract you and be addicited to the illusory online life.then i will elaborate on it’s induction mechanism through some scientific data detailedly.firstly,the content likes the short video or the short text and images has cannibalized and castrated the undergradutes ’ intension.according to stanford’s research,our contemporary people has become more and more diffivult to concentrate complex content like a film or a thick and complicated book because the abundant short video which possess the charctistics like faster speed and a mass of information are stimulating your brain whille you are reading them which would casue your intension and the ability to self-exploration and resolving problems be declined and more difficult to enter the state of flow(mihaly csikszentmihalyi).more fearsome,this mechanism would be addicted and difficult to solve.secondly,social media may deepen our anxiety and be harmful for our mental health.as the “survivorship blas”and the thought of everyone want to show a perfect figure that almost all time we will see others success and blessedness.and then,we will compare them with ourselves
subconsciously.this peer pressure leads to self-doubt like only you live in mediocity and sruggle.sometimes,it may magnify your suffering.this feeling calle‘‘fomo(fear of missing out)’’is n important factor of depression,anxiety and difficulty for sleeping.meanwhile,the online social life may lead to the ignorance of real life.according to the repory,the time we spend in social media has explosive increase and the time we communicate with others face to face have been declined absolutely.last,we have to face up to the dark side of the social media.in order to attract and retain users,the algorithm will containly to push the information you suppoted to that will cause a wrong cognize that many people think same with me even though is false.this mechanism called “information cocoons” leads to cognitive blas that the opinion we cn get become more and more monotonous and eroded the ability of dialectial thinking.furthermore,the wrong information and rumors can be easily spread on the internet which can be a challenge for undergraduates who have not grasped the media literacy.so,for the undergrates who have just entered the state of maturity,social media can be harmful.

as far as i am concerned,i believed that the soicial media is more helpful rather than harmful for undergraduates if you grasp the digital literacy.there is no doubt that the social media is a double-edged sword,but whether the balade would stab at yourself or make you more powerful,it depends on how and why you use the social media.
